multi_topic_discovery.topic_discovery_motivation: Impact: rates; Trump’s pressure on Fed policy and inflation expectations shape market expectations of future rate moves and Treasury yields.

category.motivation: The article provides commentary on market expectations regarding Fed policy and political pressure, which is a market commentary.

impact.motivation: The article reports political pressure on Fed policy, which may affect market expectations but is unlikely to alter the Fed’s stance, giving it a moderate relevance.

time_frame.motivation: The article discusses immediate political pressure on the Fed and short‑term expectations for its July policy meeting.

article_node.title: Trump has ramped up pressure on Fed Chair Powell to cut rates. There's one big reason it probably won't work.
article_node.summary: President Trump is pressuring Fed Chair Jerome Powell to cut rates this year, but Powell—11 months from the end of his term—will likely prioritize preserving the Fed’s independence and legacy, making rate cuts unlikely. Trump’s public insults and potential early announcement of a successor may backfire, reinforcing Powell’s resistance to political pressure. Market expectations remain that the Fed will keep rates steady at its July meeting, with a 79% probability of no significant cuts.
